hints.content: For fractions to be equivalent, they must represent the same area of the whole.
Let's use a visual model to see which fractions shade the same area of the whole as $\blueD{\dfrac{3}{6}}$.

![rectangle with 3 of 6 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 sixth. same sized rectangle below it, with 1 of 2 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 half](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/363b1a864ee84b42a63a49ce556f56ce7aa13c5e)

$\blueD{\dfrac{3}{6}} = \greenD{\dfrac{1}{2}}$

![rectangle with 3 of 6 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 sixth. same sized rectangle below it, with 5 of 8 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 eighth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/408fbd85d0a4d93963240af400367f766c30de8e)

$\blueD{\dfrac{3}{6}} \neq \maroonD{\dfrac{5}{8}}$

![rectangle with 3 of 6 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 sixth. same sized rectangle below it, with 4 of 8 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 eighth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3777fab223436475913576b13639e00696b4488a)

$\blueD{\dfrac{3}{6}} = \purpleD{\dfrac{4}{8}}$

![rectangle with 3 of 6 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 sixth. same sized rectangle below it, with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 fourth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/555c2a8ff29a198da586823c2ff7e8bae104e722)

$\blueD{\dfrac{3}{6}} \neq \goldE{\dfrac{3}{4}}$

The following fractions are equivalent to $\blueD{\dfrac36}$:

- $\greenD{\dfrac{1}{2}}$
- $\purpleD{\dfrac{4}{8}}$

question.content:
**Which of the following fractions are equivalent to $\dfrac36$?**
